content:
Smoke Outlook for September 2 & 3 , 2017

Incident: Sunrise Fire Wildfire
Released: 4 hrs. ago

Smoke: Somewhat better air quality will continue across the area today with daytime west winds, becoming calmer overnight, allowing smoke to settle back down into valleys by early morning. Increased fire activity due to higher winds, especially on Sunday, will produce more smoke overall.

Fire: Dry and breezy conditions today will lead to critical fire weather conditions in some areas today, higher winds on Sunday will lead to more widespread critical fire weather conditions. Fire activity will be influence by these winds, which will strongest at higher elevations.

Other: Winds will increase, strongest at higher elevations, today and tomorrow with even drier air moving into the region tonight. The next change in the weather is Monday and Tuesday when cooler weather and east winds are possible. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke response information (see link below).

http://wildlandfiresmoke.net/outlooks/2017/Montana#N
